title: How to Cancel a Zelle Payment and Get Help For an Incorrect Payment

steps.title: No, you cannot cancel a Zelle payment if it's already gone through.
steps.content: No, you cannot cancel a Zelle payment if it's already gone through. Zelle payments are sent immediately, so if you send your payment to the wrong person, you cannot recall or cancel it. [1] X Research source There is only one exception to this, and that's if your Zelle payment is pending because the other user doesn't have a Zelle account yet. If your payment is pending due to the recipient not having signed up for Zelle yet, you can go to your Zelle page on the Zelle app or your mobile banking app, select the payment you want to cancel, and tap the Cancel This Payment option. [2] X Research source

steps.title: If you sent a payment erroneously, there are a few options you can take.
steps.content: If you sent a payment erroneously, there are a few options you can take. If the payment has been processed, Zelle isn't able to reimburse you, but there are a few other things you can try instead: Send a payment request to the person you sent the money to. The user may send the money back to you, but unfortunately, they are not obligated to do so. Contact your bank. If you sent a payment by mistake or were the victim of a money transfer scam, contact your bank for help. Zelle cannot help you retrieve a processed payment, so you should look up the customer service number for your particular bank.
